title: Verify Standings Default to 2012
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Main Menu
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Standings cell
custom_expected:
Then the Standings page will open
And will default to standings for the 2012 season

title: Verify Stats are restricted to 2012
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Stats section
custom_steps: When viewing the stats
custom_expected: Then all stats displayed will be limited to the 2012 season for both players and teams

title: Scoreboard will be locked on the last game of the World Series
custom_preconds: Given the World Series has concluded
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And attempts to go past the date of the last play World Series game
custom_expected:
Then the Scoreboard will be locked
And will not allow the user to go past the final game's date

title: Verify News/Videos is restricted to 2012
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the News/Video page
custom_steps: When viewing articles & highlights
custom_expected: Then all articles & highlights displayed will be limited to the 2012 season

title: Verify Video Search is Restricted to 2012 - Team Highlights
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to the News/Video section
Or the user is the Teams section
custom_steps: When a team is selected
custom_expected: Then only highlights for 2012 will be displayed for the selected player

title: Verify Video Search is restricted to 2012 - Player Highlights
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to the News/Video section
Or the user is the Teams section(via the More menu)
custom_steps:
When the "Search <team name> Highlights" field is tapped
And the user selects a player from the index
custom_expected: Then only highlights for 2012 will be displayed for the selected player

title: Verify 'date pickers' are restricted to 2012 in Scoreboard and MLB.tv Grid
custom_preconds: Given the 2012 season has concluded
custom_steps: When attempting to navigate past any date after the last game of the World Series has been played
custom_expected: Then the user will be restricted to the date of the final World Series in both the Scoreboard & the MLB.TV grid

title: Verify Tapping on News cell opens corresponding team's news index
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to a team page
custom_steps: When the Latest News cell has been tapped
custom_expected: Then the team's corresponding news page will open

title: Verify Tapping on 'Video Highlights' cell opens corresponding team's video index
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to a team page
custom_steps: When the Video Highlights cell has been tapped
custom_expected: Then the corresponding video highlights page for the team will open

title: ***2013 schedule when it comes out, will be an added cell on this page

title: Scenario: Archived Feeds are Open

custom_expected: Then the archived stream will launch successfully and play without issue

custom_expected:

custom_preconds:

custom_steps:

custom_expected: Then the Highlight index will display 5 highlight videos

title: Scenario: Entering Search Text and Scrolling Through Highlight Index
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Video menu option
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the Search icon in the top right corner
AND the user taps on the Search Field
AND the user waits for the Search Results to populate the Video Index
custom_expected: Then scrolling up/down on the index does not cause the app to crash

title: Scenario: Verify that searching for a name results in results that correlate
custom_preconds:
Given the user has tapped on the Video menu option
And the user has tapped on the Search icon in the top right corner
custom_steps: When a text string is entered into the Search field
custom_expected:
Then the result set will correlate to that which was entered by the user
And will not present random results (in many cases the video title will not have anything to do what was entered by the user but still may be represented during playback. (i.e. If Miguel Cabrera was used as the search criteria but his name is not seen in the title, it may be because he was mentioned during the video playback.)

title: If login fingerprint expires, should get a new one automatically in bg. Check that you can checkin to one game then another game later that day or next day
custom_preconds:
MLB.com - Expires every 4 hours
Foursquare - Never Expires
Facebook - Never Expires as we request an offline token.  If we exit the application though it will log us out so we just need to hit "Login" again.
